snippet: After fleeing from ISIS, the Yazidis, a tiny religious minority, are caught up in a larger refugee disaster occurring across Iraq, one that is hitting Kurdistan especially hard.
abstract: Thousands of Yazidis, members of religious minority in Iraq allied with Kurds, have become trapped in Sinjar mountains without any food or water as they try to escape death by militants from Islamic State in Iraq and Syria; no one yet has numbered how many Yazidis have been executed by ISIS, but Pres Obama has called it potential genocide.
